tags: I want V to return home and get welcome home smooches!!
summary: Do you think V's boyfriend/girlfriend will live with him or her?
question: Do you think V's boyfriend/girlfriend will live with him or her?
answer:
Ok so legit I have been thinking about this. Of course I wanna say YES!!

V moves in with their partner and whenever V returns home they can greet them.

Realistically speaking, if it’s gonna happen, it will probably be near the end of the game???

Cdpr, give us that domestic goodness!!!

summary:
#Cyberpunk2077 no tendrá un sistema de moralidad

CD Projekt Red, para The Witcher 3, utilizó un sistema de elecciones gris, es...
caption:
#Cyberpunk2077 no tendrá un sistema de moralidad

CD Projekt Red, para The Witcher 3, utilizó un sistema de elecciones gris, es decir que ninguna decisión importante en el juego era ni buena ni mala.

tags: After the trailer V and Jackie reunited because Jackie DID NOT DIE!
summary: Male!V Looked so sad and ready to burst into tears. He was trying so hard not to  cry and was just barely keeping it together.
question: Male!V Looked so sad and ready to burst into tears. He was trying so hard not to  cry and was just barely keeping it together.
answer:
He really did. As soon as V looked into that mirror I knew, I knew, something was wrong!! He looked so vulnerable ;-; but then he kicked ass!!

I know it was a cinematic trailer, but they really managed to convey emotion so well! I already love these characters tbh.

reblog.comment:

summary: About The Character I was tagged by @jacobmybeloved and @thefathersbride for this, thank you!! I feel bad for not tagging anyone...
body:
About The Character

I was tagged by @jacobmybeloved and @thefathersbride for this, thank you!!

I feel bad for not tagging anyone but I would hate to tag someone who’s already done it so I won’t.

I couldn’t decide who to do this for so I’m going to do it twice for my Cyberpunk 2077 OC Ghost and my main FC5 OC Casy~

― your muse’s name alias: “Ghost” 

― one favorite picture / faceclaim of your muse:

― two headcanons you have for your muse:

  • She has a side business selling potentially incriminating information on anyone and everyone
  • May or may not be a cyborg

― three things that your muse likes doing in their free time:

  • Find obscure spots around the city to do yoga in
  • Plays the occasional video game
  • Collecting the stereotypical little green alien trinkets

― seven people your muse loves/likes: The game isn’t out yet so I don’t really know the characters yet. Being a bartender though she likes her customers to an extent because they tip well.

― a phobia your muse has:

  • Letting someone get close to her again and losing them

also getting shot, it’s happened before and she does not like it

*

― your muse’s name: Casy Violet Bell

― one favourite picture / faceclaim of your muse:

― two headcanons you have for your muse:

  • She makes her own dresses
  • She’s happiest when around Faith

― three things that your muse likes doing in their free time:

  • Painting/sketching
  • Making origami
  • Swimming in lakes

― seven people your muse loves/likes:

  • Faith
  • Joseph
  • John
  • Jacob
  • Micah (my other OC)
  • and that’s about it

― a phobia your muse has: 

  • Losing Faith or being shunned by the cult

blog.name: videogamesincolor
blog.title: Video Games in Color
blog.description: Video Games in Color is a gaming blog strictly dedicated to characters of color in video games and the media that surrounds them. We cover news, videos, lets play by players of color and reblog content related to characters of color. That's the short and simple truth of it.

summary: Deeply transphobic ad in ‘Cyberpunk 2077’ represents everything wrong with cyberpunk
title: Deeply transphobic ad in ‘Cyberpunk 2077’ represents everything wrong with cyberpunk
excerpt: During E3 2019, CD Projekt revealed a screenshot for 'Cyberpunk 2077' with a transphobic ad. It's the third bigoted joke from CD Projekt in just one year.
description:
“[…]Even if the ad is supposed to depict a trans woman or a trans femme in good faith, it’s terribly inaccurate in a way that furthers harmful stereotypes already existing in our society.”

“[…]But it’s unlikely that Cyberpunk 2077 will bring about the change Cole or Baker-Whitelaw want, because its own creator seems happy with capitalism as it stands today.”

“[…]So before CD Projekt starts playing with gender in hamfisted ways, perhaps the company should look to itself, and question whether it’s perpetuating the very same capitalist dystopian fantasy Cyberpunk 2077 is, on the surface, trying to critique.”

reblog.comment:
“[…]Even if the ad is supposed to depict a trans woman or a trans femme in good faith, it’s terribly inaccurate in a way that furthers harmful stereotypes already existing in our society.”

“[…]But it’s unlikely that Cyberpunk 2077 will bring about the change Cole or Baker-Whitelaw want, because its own creator seems happy with capitalism as it stands today.”

“[…]So before CD Projekt starts playing with gender in hamfisted ways, perhaps the company should look to itself, and question whether it’s perpetuating the very same capitalist dystopian fantasy Cyberpunk 2077 is, on the surface, trying to critique.”

trail.content_raw:
“[…]Even if the ad is supposed to depict a trans woman or a trans femme in good faith, it’s terribly inaccurate in a way that furthers harmful stereotypes already existing in our society.”

“[…]But it’s unlikely that Cyberpunk 2077 will bring about the change Cole or Baker-Whitelaw want, because its own creator seems happy with capitalism as it stands today.”

“[…]So before CD Projekt starts playing with gender in hamfisted ways, perhaps the company should look to itself, and question whether it’s perpetuating the very same capitalist dystopian fantasy Cyberpunk 2077 is, on the surface, trying to critique.”
trail.content:
“[…]Even if the ad is supposed to depict a trans woman or a trans femme in good faith, it’s terribly inaccurate in a way that furthers harmful stereotypes already existing in our society.”

“[…]But it’s unlikely that Cyberpunk 2077 will bring about the change Cole or Baker-Whitelaw want, because its own creator seems happy with capitalism as it stands today.”

“[…]So before CD Projekt starts playing with gender in hamfisted ways, perhaps the company should look to itself, and question whether it’s perpetuating the very same capitalist dystopian fantasy Cyberpunk 2077 is, on the surface, trying to critique.”

summary: Deal of the Day: Cyberpunk 2077  After a huge outing at E3 2019 with a major Keanu Reeves reveal, Cyberpunk 2077 has become one...
caption:
Deal of the Day: Cyberpunk 2077

After a huge outing at E3 2019 with a major Keanu Reeves reveal, Cyberpunk 2077 has become one of the most anticipated games of the year. You can get your hands on a discounted pre-order price only for a limited time.

What is this: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. You play as V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you.

  • Was: $59.99
  • Now: $49.94
  • You Save: 17%

Since this game is becoming even more popular leading up to release, this deal is most likely capitalizing on it. This means the deal won’t be around much longer so, be sure to lock in your pre-order at this special price for PlayStation 4, Xbox One or PC.

PRE-ORDER: Cyberpunk 2077
